arts.ttl: Narcis Pelach's Stoke City 'love' verdict as team starts to emerge from squad
arts.sum: It's just one point I know but the performance of the team was good. Narcis Pelach has told his Stoke City players to nurture the love as he already starts to see a team emerge under his watch as head coach.

arts.ttl: Swansea City ratings as Vigouroux superb again in Stoke City stalemate
arts.sum: Here's how the players rated in the goalless draw with Stoke

arts.ttl: Stoke City player ratings vs Swansea as Viktor Johansson helps secure draw
arts.sum: It was Ronald, too, who set up Jisung Eom to hit the crossbar on the cusp of half-time as Swansea broke from a disputed goal-kick, awarded by a puzzled-looking referee Andy Davies after Swansea had bundled it behind their own line from a Junho corner. Ronald was Swansea’s biggest threat, finding space when crosses came in from the Swansea left and he should have buried at least one, when he screwed past the far post, while he caused havoc from another when Wouter Burger ended up needing to make a frantic block top stop a shot from Matt Grimes.

arts.ttl: Swansea and Stoke share points in entertaining draw
arts.sum: Stoke had arrived in Wales on the back of a 6-1 midweek demolition of Portsmouth.

arts.ttl: Swansea City 0-0 Stoke City: Hosts left frustrated in goalless stalemate

arts.ttl: Swansea vs Stoke City live news, action and reaction from Liberty Stadium
arts.sum: Stoke City are in action at Swansea as they try to build on Narcis Pelach's opening win as head coach. Swansea have won three and drawn two of their opening eight matches of the season but are unbeaten in four at home, where they have only conceded twice so far.

arts.ttl: Stoke were absolutely exceptional but there was food for thought for boss too
arts.sum: That helped the likes of Tom Cannon, making runs in behind, Sam Gallagher pulling off short – that double act started to develop – and we saw Cannon being released, linking with Gallagher, and we saw the best of Wouter Burger with his passing ability in the attacking half. It wasn’t about making 790 passes from the back, it was one, two and three-touch play, positive forward thinking that produced momentum.
